meanings.definition: To put to death painlessly or allow to die, as by withholding extreme medical measures
meanings.sent1: The vet had to euthanize the old dog to end its suffering.
meanings.sent2: The family made the difficult decision to euthanize their beloved pet.
meanings.sent3: The kind act to euthanize the wilting flowers saved them from further wilting.
meanings.sent4: In the game, the player had to euthanize the enemy to progress to the next level.
meanings.sent5: The humane way to euthanize the injured bird was to gently put it to sleep.

meanings.definition: To kill in a painless or minimally painful way
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper had to euthanize the sick zebra to prevent its suffering.
meanings.sent2: The farmer had to euthanize the injured cow to prevent its pain.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to euthanize the lobster before cooking it for the dish.
meanings.sent4: The hunter had to euthanize the deer to ensure a quick and painless death.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to euthanize the lab mice after the experiment was completed.
